{"justification": "The student has correctly applied the Pythagorean theorem to find the length of AB, which is a necessary step in finding the distance from B to line AC. {"justification": "The student has correctly realized that in a right-angled triangle, the side opposite the right angle (in this case, BA) is perpendicular to the side adjacent to the right angle (AC). They have correctly concluded that the distance from B to line AC is the length of BA, which they have already calculated to be $6sqrt{3}$ cm. This shows that the student has correctly answered the tutor's previous question and has arrived at a complete solution for the entirety of the initial *Problem Statement*, corresponding to selections 'f' and 'j'.
